title: Wythenshawe Park Walking and Cycle Route

images.title: Dave Smethurst / Wythenshawe park, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Wythenshawe park. This is the view out of the main entrance to Wythenshawe park. The picture was taken from SJ815900 looking north towards Wythenshawe Road.

images.title: Eirian Evans / Carved bench, Wythenshawe Park, via Wikimedia Commons
images.caption: Carved bench, Wythenshawe Park Hand-carved oak bench in the park.

description: Enjoy walking and cycling in this large park in Manchester. The park has miles of nice walking trails while National Cycle Network Route 85 also runs through it. The park covers 260 acres (109 hectares) and includes wildflower meadows, pretty gardens, herbaceous borders, woodland and grassland. You can also enjoy a waterside stroll along the Baguley Brook and visit the community farm. Here you'll find cows, sheep, goats, pigs, ducks, horses and all the elements of a working countryside farm in an urban setting. The extensive parkland surrounds the 16th-century medieval house of Wythenshawe Hall. The timber-framed manor house was home to the Tatton family for over 600 years. To extend your exercise you could head through Northenden and pick up the Trans Pennine Trail along the River Mersey. Also nearby is Chorlton Water Park where there are more nice walking and cycling trails around a large lake. Just beyond there is Sale Water Park which is also well worth a visit.
